item.title: Tanti add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "What is worth having is worth working for." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Tanti add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tanti add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Tanti add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tanti add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Tanti add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Tanti add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Tanti add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "I'll be looking for you, Will, every moment, every single moment. And when we do find each other again, we'll cling together so tight that nothing and no one'll ever tear us apart. Every atom of me and every atom of you... We'll live in birds and flowers and dragonflies and pine trees and in clouds and in those little specks of light you see floating in sunbeams... And when they use our atoms to make new lives, they wont' just be able to take one, they'll have to take two, one of you and one of me, we'll be joined so tight..." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Tanti add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "People are too complicated to have simple labels." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Tanti add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "The truth." Dumbledore sighed. "It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution." -- J.K. Rowling
